image.altText: a young aboriginal man smiling, wearing a black cap, t-shirt and silver necklaces

props.synopsis: Young Territorians including Darwin rapper J-MILLA have voiced concerns over a proposed bill that would allow the NT police commissioner to impose snap curfews.

title.children: Young NT leaders fear proposed curfew bill will unfairly target youth

image.altText: A gas platform in the Timor Sea.

props.synopsis: The Environmental Defenders Office was criticised over its involvement in a court case that saw Indigenous elders challenge plans to build a gas pipeline between a major gas field and Darwin Harbour.

title.children: Environmental Defenders Office did not breach $8.2m grant agreement over NT gas case, review finds

image.altText: A portrait photo of Nicole Zuritta.

props.synopsis: Nicole Zuritta's friend was murdered in one of Australia's most notorious serial killings, turning her world upside down. Almost three decades on, she wants to reframe the way victims of the Snowtown murders are remembered.

title.children: It looked like a run-of-the-mill robbery, but what she found at home were traces of the Snowtown serial killings

image.altText: People standing around with cars on the side of a road and small plastic chairs on the ground

props.synopsis: The Department of Foreign Affairs says it is providing consular assistance to an Australian in the wake of several gunmen opening fire in the city of Bamyan.

title.children: Australian injured in deadly shooting in Afghanistan

image.altText: Newcastle Knights centre Bradman Best stands on the field during NRL Magic Round against the Gold Coast Titans.

props.synopsis: The Sharks and Roosters play out a blockbuster after Knights centre Bradman Best becomes the latest Blues player hit by the hamstring curse, unable to play the second half of Newcastle's 28-24 win over the Titans. Follow live.

title.children: Game of Magic Round kicks off as table-topping Sharks take on red-hot Roosters

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: FULL-TIME: Newcastle wins another chaotic clash with the Titans
Wait a minute. The bunker says no try!

image.altText: A pack of Crows and Magpies players converge around the ball

props.synopsis: Collingwood survive a massive scare against Kuwarna/Adelaide Crows as a late Jordan De Goey goal pinches a four-point win at the MCG. Follow live.

title.children: De Goey goal snatches victory for Magpies as Crows fall short in thriller

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: QT: Giants lead the Dogs by eight points after scratchy quarter
FT: Magpies beat Crows in frantic finish!

image.altText: Protesters knocking against a wooden wall

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and Premier Jacinta Allan had their speeches delayed as protesters were ushered out of the Moonee Valley Racecourse by police.

title.children: Premier Jacinta Allan condemns protesters who stormed state Labor conference

image.altText: A woman with hands on her hips poses in front of a monument on a holiday.

props.synopsis: For decades, women in Australia have been told they should have more children for the good of the country, but  there's many reasons why more are choosing to stay child free.

title.children: Having babies in Australia is 'not a good deal', and more women are saying 'not for me'

image.altText: Children's author Oliver Phommavanh with his arms and head resting on a big pile of his books.

props.synopsis: Oliver Phommavanh is alleged to have sent inappropriate photos and videos to someone he thought was a 13-year-old girl.

title.children: Sydney children's author charged for alleged online grooming of girl he thought was 13yo

image.altText: security video thumb sean combs diddy

props.synopsis: Security video aired by CNN appears to show Sean "Diddy" Combs attacking singer Cassie in a Los Angeles hotel hallway in 2016, the latest in a months-long series of public allegations and revelations of physical and sexual violence from the hip-hop mogul.

title.children: Security footage from 2016 appears to show rap mogul Sean 'Diddy' Combs beating singer Cassie

image.altText: Rugby league player in a hoodie, arrives at a stadium

props.synopsis: Penrith Panthers winger Taylan May has been arrested and charged with domestic violence offences.

title.children: Panthers winger Taylan May charged with domestic violence offences

image.altText: Kiwi crossing in New Zealand

props.synopsis: As New Zealanders grapple with high interest rates, stubborn inflation and general economic downturn, job losses have begun and more Kiwis than ever are leaving for good.

title.children: 'It is crunch time': Kiwis are leaving NZ at a record rate, and they're headed to Australia

image.altText: Les Cameron stands out the front of his pub.

props.synopsis: Inspired by the legacy of Ernest Hemingway's free room and board in Paris, a footballer turned publican is offering a comfy bed and warm meal for anyone pursuing an artistic endeavour.

title.children: Les will let you stay in his old-fashioned country pub for free. He just asks for one thing in return

image.altText: A footballer sat on the ground with a ball at his feet

props.synopsis: Football Australia issues no fault suspensions to three Macarthur FC players after they were charged over an alleged betting scandal.

title.children: 'No place in our game': Three A-League players stood down over alleged betting scandal

image.altText: a man holding a mug in the kitchen

props.synopsis: After decades as a big coffee drinker, Jesse recently gave it away, and says he is already noticing health improvements. Experts agree there is a range of benefits to ditching the daily grind.

title.children: Life after coffee: Why quitting caffeine makes sense for your mind and your bank balance

image.altText: Very young smooth-looking platypus babies held in a pair of hands at night close-up.

props.synopsis: Kangaroos have joeys and dingoes have pups, but what do you call a baby platypus? If you think "puggle", think again.

title.children: Why some researchers want you to stop using the word 'puggle' for platypus babies

image.altText: Musician Boo Seeka standing onstage at a music festival in front of a large crowd, with his back facing the camera and arms out.

props.synopsis: Ahead of the Northern Territory's biggest music festival Bass in the Grass, research shows party-goers want access to pill testing.

title.children: 'It would make us feel safer': Festival-goers support drug testing in the NT

image.altText: A side profile close up of Peter Dutton.

props.synopsis: The significance of a major political leader playing so divisive a card on our community is a step that shouldn't go unnoticed, no matter how inured to it we have become over the years in the wake of Pauline Hanson and "boat people" politics.

title.children: Dutton has reduced a massively complex issue to a populist and misleading piece of political mischief

image.altText: Flames lick the edge of the frame as Kevin Waters sits watching a smoking ceremony at Old Toomelah, March 2024.

props.synopsis: Kevin Waters is the last surviving Gomeroi man born at the Old Toomelah Aboriginal mission near the NSW-Queensland border. His life's purpose now is to ensure his family remains connected to a culture they were once forced to forget.

title.children: Born in the bush, 95-year-old Kevin Waters takes one last trip back to Old Toomelah

image.altText: Dr Peter Renshaw sits in front of a microphone.

props.synopsis: The Medical Board of Australia has suspended Dr Peter Renshaw's medical practitioner registration. It comes after an investigation was launched into allegations he falsified death certificates.

title.children: Medical licence of ex-hospital boss suspended amid allegations of falsifying death certificates

image.altText: The scene of a crash between a ute and a truck.

props.synopsis: The victims — a woman and a man both aged in their 60s — were on a South Australian regional road when their ute was involved in a crash with a truck.

title.children: Horrific truck crash claims lives of two in ute in regional SA

image.altText: Three dolphins leaping out of a pool together.

props.synopsis: After failing to secure government funding, a wildlife tourist park and dolphin welfare groups have mutually walked away from a plan to build a sea pen.

title.children: Last three captive dolphins in NSW to remain in pools after sea pen plan scrapped

image.altText: a church

props.synopsis: Former churches are being given a new lease on life as homes and holiday accommodation, as places of worship close their doors and are sold.

title.children: 'Not the biggest house, but we love it': Transforming a 120yo church into a family home

image.altText: Rows of macadamia nut trees

props.synopsis: It's known for its fresh fruit and veggies, stunning beaches, and proximity to the southern Great Barrier Reef, but soon the Bundaberg region could also be home to a coking coal mine.

title.children: Farmers fight for food bowl on edge of Great Barrier Reef amid coal exploration push

image.altText: Protesters clash outside a Cumberland City Council

props.synopsis: Libraries and librarians are common targets for attacks because they are easy for the public to access and because they represent learning, ideas, imagination, equality, choice and barrier-free access to information for all.

title.children: The same-sex parenting book bans are just the latest chapter in Australia's long history of library censorship

image.altText: A man smiling with a koala in the background.

props.synopsis: Parents and students from an all-girls Catholic college on the NSW Central Coast want conservative American author and chastity promoter Jason Evert's planned talk this week cancelled, with a petition overnight amassing 700 signatures.

title.children: 'Deeply problematic': Plan for chastity project founder to visit all-girls high school sparks outrage

image.altText: Coke cans at a WA containers for change depot

props.synopsis: Coca-Cola has been taking free water from a bore in Karragullen for decades, to sell as bottled water. As Perth endures one of its driest ever spells, questions are being asked about what that means for the region.

title.children: Nobody knows how much free water Coca-Cola is taking from Perth's aquifers. How did this happen?

image.altText: smoke over buildings.

props.synopsis: Experts and observers say the discord in New Caledonia has built amid a deepening economic divide and a prolonged stalemate over the future of its status as a French territory.

title.children: 'Ripped open a seam in society': Why New Caledonia's violent riots this week are unsurprising for many

image.altText: A mother in white shirt with brown long hair kisses her baby on his head as she holds him

props.synopsis: Regional families with sick children say they are at breaking point as they struggle with lengthy wait times for specialist medical appointments and mounting travel costs.

title.children: Baby Chace is hospitalised regularly due to a recurring illness but has to wait months to see a specialist

image.altText: a composite image of a man going into the water at a perth and fog blankets sydney harbour

props.synopsis: For the second time this May, Australia's normally mobile weather systems have ground to a halt, with the coming week bringing another prolonged spell of invariable day-to-day weather.

title.children: Australia's weather map freezes for second time, laying the platform for record May in Perth, Adelaide and parts of NSW

image.altText: social housing unit - toilet and walls wrecked

props.synopsis: Aymee Hewitt and her growing family are on the housing waitlist. They are among those outraged at the destruction of a social housing unit in Tasmania's north that is now unliveable.

title.children: 'It makes me really angry': Mother waiting for social housing laments trashing of in-demand home

image.altText: Adam Driver stars as architect and time turner Cesar Catilina in Megalopolis.

props.synopsis: Francis Ford Coppola once called Megalopolis "a movie that costs a lot of money to make and there's not a patron out there". So, 40 years in the making, was it worth it? Here's what the critics said after its Cannes premiere.

title.children: 'Megabloated' or 'Masterpiece'? Francis Ford Coppola's Megalopolis splits critics after 40-year journey
